comment: The class is super easy. You have 4 open note tests in class. Online, there are homework assignments you have an unlimited amount of tries to get a 100% on and online quizzes which you can take three times. Overall, the class is boring and he can make things more confusing than they should be, but I'm glad I took it and got an easy A.

Prof Zagrodny is a wonderful professor and takes time to make sure everyone understands the material. He's a little goofy and once in awhile makes very minor mistakes. You get a sheet of notes on each test and two sheets on the final. He gives study guides! DO THE HW! I had a 95 test average, but because I missed some hw I almost didn't get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Zagrodny is one of the clearest math instructors I've ever had. Made As on all his tests. Sort of an interesting character. Sometimes makes mistakes on the board, but he catches them. Show up pay attention, do the homework, certainly ask questions if you have them (he'll break it down). He's usually available to help.

He is a very interesting character. He does want his students to succeed but is very unclear and has a lot of trouble explaining things sometimes. If you are not very good at math, he is not a terrible professor to have just have good tutor outside of class. He does allow 2 pages of notes for each test and drops the lowest quiz and test grade.
This professor is very nice he wants to make sure the student pass their test and he will do any thing to help. i think people are give him a bad name and he is very nice.

Professor Zagrodny made this class the easiest math class I have ever taken. All tests are open note, even the final! He gives you a million chances to make up homework and he drops the 2 lowest quiz grades. The class may be boring, but he is a nice man who wants everyone to succeed.

Math has never been my favorite subject, but Prof. Zagrodny made it enjoyable! The lectures are boring, but Zagrodny does anything he can to help his students pass. His tests are easy as long as you do your study guides and if you don't go to class, his powerpoints are online. He is a good professor, no serious complaints!
If you're good at teaching yourself, then this class will be an easy A. He's not really good at explaining. However, he does a lot of examples of problems during class.

He posted powerpoints online and practice tests. He also gave many homeworks to help us practice. Also, if you showed for his office hours he was very helpful. Many people complained his class was hard and he was not a good teacher...which I found at times it was hard to listen to him but all in all he is a good teacher you just have to try.

He is very awkward and seems to be nervous in front of the class. The online homework is way easy. You get six tries. The tests are kind of hard because they do not relate to the homework at ALL. He stutters and sometimes is hard to understand his points.

He gets confused a lot and writes the wrong thing and doesn't correct it even when someone catches it, which confuses everyone. He only teaches half the material and puts all of it on the test. This is fine, if he teaches the 1st half in a way you can understand. I absolutely do not recommend this teacher and I did fairly well.

He is a very helpful professor!! Even though he is odd, he is always willing to help. He will stay after class, meet you before, and emails online frequently. If anyone complains about him, its because they dont know how lucky they are to have such a helpful teacher. He explains things very in depth, and let's you have a cheat sheet for test. Nice!

Guy is a total nerd, he gets nervous easily. If you need a class to breeze thru bc yu already know it take him. If you struggle he is NOT the person to take. 4 tests during the semester all pretty damn simple. and hw thats more for participation grade. He grades easy thou and you can prob talk him into anything.

He's not a self confident man, which definitely reflects in his teaching. The material isn't hard, so the class is boring. In the end I'm happy I stayed. On test he lets you use 2 pages of notes, and the test are basically like the study guides!But I do not recommend buying the BOOK. It's such a waste of money, just get the webassign online key.
He is a great teacher. just go to class and pay attention and you will do fine! he is really good at giving extra time for assignments and his study guides are just like the tests. highly recommend.

This class has the potential to be an easy A/B. I didnt buy the book, just the online access code for hmwk. He works through all the problems and answers questions. He does his job and teaches well, just not a real people person and I dnt really mind that. You have about 1 hmwk assignment online a week and tests are based off those.

Mr. Zagrondy is a really nice man.  This is not a class for those who want to learn how to do this type of math.  He will help you and he gives you ample time to make corrections and turn your assignments in.  I don't like math and I just wanted to get through it.  I did have to teach myself but, I got through it.

This professor tries so hard. He is very nice but teaching is a people person type career. He knows his stuff but should be practicing it outside of teaching. He just doesn't seem to be comfortable in front of a classroom. I would not take him again but it is an easy A if you can teach yourself.

Honestly, the worst math teacher I have ever had. Not only does he mess up examples on the board, but he NEVER answers any questions. He has questions on the test that cover material that was never mentioned in class and as if that wasn't bad enough you can barely understand what he says because every other word out of his mouth is "basically".

I think he's probably one of the worst math teachers I've ever had. It's a good thing my father is a Math and Chemistry Professor at another university. I have no learned anything and he is not easy to listen to. He says basically, um, basically all the time, basically.Drop the class if you want to learn, otherwise have fun!

Do not take this class if you want to actually learn. He's nice, but he is impossible to listen to. I wish I had dropped this class a long time ago like the others on this site advised. If you're good at learning on your own, you'll be fine, but I'm not. I had a borderline 80 grade, less than a point below, and he refused to bump it up. Fail.

He is a really nice guy, unfortuately he cannot teach. He is very nervous in front of a class and is pretty horrible at explaining everything. With that said, his class is pretty easy. He gives study guides for every test and the tests are always almost exactly like study guide. Lets you use notes on every test.

His class is extremely easy. You can use 2 pages (front and back) on every test. Weekly quizzes given, but they are over the material given that day. He does have a problem with public speaking, but if you talk to him one on one he is fine. If you are not a math major, this class will stand as a gen. ed. requirement.

The poor man has trouble looking at people. That said, he wants you to succeed. He handed out study guides for the tests--and you could use them while taking the test! While not the same questions, same process. Stick it out. I think half my class got As. (A lot dropped after the first week. Fools!)

He should definitely not be teaching college, much less teaching at all. He does not know how to present his material in a way which is beneficial to the students, and he continuously makes errors on his tests and his in-class examples. He has trouble communicating and you can hardly understand him. Do not take his course, take a different prof.

He is a really nice guy who knows the material well, but he is terrible at public speaking. His course is not hard, and the practice tests are just like the real tests with different numbers. He stutters and stumbles over his words, but he really does know the material and tried to be helpful.

worse teach ever. do not take him if you actually want/need to learn math. he has no idea what he is talking about half of the time and his notes never make sense. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. half of the people dropped it after the first day, i wish i was one of them!

Worst teacher I have ever had. I have no idea what he's saying most of the time. I end up not going to class because it's a waste of time, you might as well just teach yourself the math. Every other word he says is "basically." He doesn't know what he's doing. You only need to show up for tests. Study the practice test before tests and you'll be ok

Nice guy, but a very, very bad teacher. Rambles & repeats himself a lot, doesn't take any control of his class & pretty much lets time slip by. The powerpoints don't really help either, but they're better than the book. Easy, but don't take his class.

Mr. Zagrodny should not be teaching. Put him in a lab somewhere. He often makes errors in his examples AND ON TESTS. He is not sure of himself enough to face the class, most of the time faces the board or looks down, speaking in an unclear tone of voice. He does not grade homework, but does take it up.  He kinda looks like Rick Moranis on a bad day
Deranged little man. In no way interesting. Total tool.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. He showed up to class with little self-confidence which allowed his students to walk all over him. He knew the material but had a very hard time presenting it in an understanding manner. Tests similar to study guides. He does allow time for student to come to his office for help. I would not recommend hi

He is not very helpful at all, however his class is pretty easy. You can cheat on every test except the final exam. He is very lenient about when homework is turned in. Attendance isn't mandatory and not really needed because this is a self-help class. He tries to teach, but he rambles alot and often has no clue what he's talking about.
